description: [Daily Trust] Microsoft has projected that Artificial Intelligence (AI) will add about $1.2 trillion to Africa's economy by the year 2030.
title: Africa: Artificial Intelligence to Contribute $1.2 Trillion to Africa's Economy - Microsoft

description: [The Herald] Wallace Ruzvidzo -- Rwandan President Paul Kagame has expressed gratitude to fellow African nations for extending their support during Rwanda's difficult 1994 genocide which saw the killing of nearly one million people in just three months.
title: Africa: Rwanda Thanks Africa for Support Post-Genocide

description: [IPS] Bulawayo -- While research into the unequal impacts of climate change on women is growing, more is needed to enable them to realize their rights to climate justice.
title: Africa: Women Affected By 'Gender-Biased' Climate Change Deserve Justice

description: [Afrobarometer] Fewer than half of households enjoy a supply of electricity that works "most" or "all" of the time.
title: Africa: Energy Gaps: Slight, Uneven Progress Still Leaves Many Africans Without Electricity

description: [allAfrica] Dar es Salaam, Tanzania -- Years of progress in the fight against malaria have been disrupted, but there is still hope.
title: Africa: Africa Still in the Fight - Eradicating Malaria Remains a Top Priority

description: [UN News] Financing for sustainable development is at a crossroads and without urgent investment, global efforts to achieve a more just and equitable world by 2030 will fail, the UN deputy chief warned on Tuesday.
title: Africa: Massive Investment and Financial Reform Needed to Rescue SDGs

description: [USIP] USIP Senior Study Group Final Report
title: Africa: Critical Minerals in Africa - Strengthening Security, Supporting Development, and Reducing Conflict Amid Geopolitical Competition

description: [USIP] USIP report offers ways for the United States to diversify its critical mineral supply chains through mutually beneficial partnerships in Africa.
title: Africa: Why Africa's Critical Minerals Are Key to U.S. National Security

description: [Afrobarometer] Living in an affluent country decreases support for good governance - and vice versa.
title: Africa: Wp203 - Economic Prosperity and Public Backing for Transparent and Accountable Governance in Africa

description: [The Conversation Africa] Scientists from the Institute for Breeding Rare and Endangered African Mammals have been working in southern Africa for over 15 years to protect endangered African wild dogs (Lycaon pictus). They've now decided to freeze sperm from as many genetically diverse male African wild dogs as possible and use this to artificially inseminate female African wild dogs for the first time. Reproductive and molecular biologist Damien Paris explains why artificial breeding is the best and most economical way to ensure
title: Africa: African Wild Dogs Will Soon Have Their Own Sperm Bank - How Artificial Breeding Will Help Them Survive

description: [African Arguments] 30-odd years after the restoration of multiparty democracy, is it time to reassess the practice of democracy?
title: Africa: Africa's Democratic Dividend
